intro: Crotalaria bongensis var. shirensis, commonly known as the Shire crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or orange flowers arranged in racemes. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid to moist environments. The seeds are encased in a distinctive, hairy pod that splits open when mature to release the seeds.
